website_summaries.verdict: Desktop processors don't get beefier—or more expensive—than the Intel Core i7-6950X. But not every user will find all its enhancements worth the money.
pros: Insanely powerful, particularly with multithreaded applications
cons: Lower clock speed may reduce utility with single- or lightly threaded workloads

customer_reviews.title: It was expensive, but worth it for what I ...
customer_reviews.text: It was expensive, but worth it for what I do. Now that more powerful cpus are coming out with amds threadripper, the choice as a consumer is going to be very difficult. Hopefully prices, match the processors we get.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Overall performance is better than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought the processor to assemble a computer for my project that asks for a lot of parallel data processing. Overclock worked well. Overall performance is better than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with the Performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this CPU February of 2017, after 2 years I'm still happy with it. It is the fastest, most advanced workhorse computer I had built to date. (As of May 2019)I have tried overclocking it but it doesn't pass the stress test afterwards. With that being said, at stock speeds i have NEVER maxed out the cpu.
customer_reviews.author: BluRidge Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great had no issues installing and setting up new computer. Overclocked currently to 4.386 GHz. May try a little more later

customer_reviews.title: Why did I buy this?
customer_reviews.text: Because I could? All jokes aside, this is great for anyone wanting to stream, edit videos, game, use virtual machines, and anything else you may want all at once. The listed ones are the things I use it for and it works perfectly for those tasks. Sure, I probably would have been fine going with any cheaper option but saying that you have this processor adds the bonus of bragging rights and people thinking you are probably stupidly in debt or rich and demand you to buy them lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Will L.

customer_reviews.title: Only get this processor if you use it for heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Only get this processor if you use it for heavy workloads. Look for another one if you're just using it for gaming.

customer_reviews.text: Works good, just wish amazon would come down on the price since it is last gen.

customer_reviews.title: I have used this processor since building my machine back ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this processor since building my machine back in July. This processor is very solid in Windows 10 and Linux Mint 18. Having this many cores allows me to play pc games without dealing with slowness. I also run various Virtual Machines in VMWorkstation 12.5. Having this processor has allowed me to continue my CCIE training since I am in the IT field. I use this processor with my Asus Deluxe II motherboard and it runs solid. It maybe overkill for the common general user but if you run a ton of VMs and gaming it's worth it. Now I can run as much machines and do pc gaming as I want and not worry about limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best CPU for X99 you can get today.
customer_reviews.text: The best CPU for X99 you can get today. - nothing else to add

customer_reviews.title: ... expensive CPU's I have ever bought but it is awesome nothing this beast can't handle so far and stays ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the most expensive CPU's I have ever bought but it is awesome nothing this beast can't handle so far and stays extremely cool for such a powerful CPU!
customer_reviews.author: TheGeneralLee1986

customer_reviews.title: 2V isn't too bad and stable
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, can't really overclock it to the max but 10 cores makes up for it. 4.6Ghz Overclock with 1.2V isn't too bad and stable. If you read the Overclock reviews there are other Intel processors that will give you higher Ghz with less heat but this will heat up so I definitely recommend a premium water cooling setup even if you're going stock. Don't run this on Air.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wood

customer_reviews.title: What can you say that isnt obvious about this chip ...
customer_reviews.text: What can you say that isnt obvious about this chip. I was able to clock it to 4.2GHz. It ran stable under all stress tests and it just rocks! I would not be able to justify this personally, but when a client pays you to build it, I have no issue. See attached screenshots for results.

customer_reviews.title: ... cpu in the mail today and everything was looking good. The outside of the processor packaging says 6950x ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the cpu in the mail today and everything was looking good. The outside of the processor packaging says 6950x and and the processor itself has 6950x etched into it. However after installing it into my assus deluxe II mobo and going into bios the proscesser is NOT a 6950x but rather a Xeon e5-1603 v4. What the #$@% is going on??

customer_reviews.title: But if you have the extra $$$ to blow and you want the best of the best
customer_reviews.text: If You are looking for a monster upgrade.... Look no further. This processor has been a huge upgrade for me. Please do your shopping and research though. This is absolutely an enthusiast's processor. There are many other choices you can find that are more cost effective and in many ways equally rated good/great for gaming. But if you have the extra $$$ to blow and you want the best of the best. Get the 6950X.

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 7 2700X OC'ed beats this cpu
customer_reviews.text: Just built a Ryzen 7 2700X rig, which overclocks very nicely. With all cores at 4.2Ghz, and DDR4-3200, CPU-Z benchmark shows the Ryzen outperforming the i7-6950X. I get a passmark CPU score of 19136 and Cinebench CPU score of 1915. The Ryzen is 20% of the price of the i7-6950X. Unless you need 40 PCI lanes, this CPU seems terribly overpriced. AMD Threadripper CPU offers 64 PCI lanes at a fraction of the cost. Purpose of this review is not to criticize this Intel CPU, but rather to offer my experience with a far less expensive alternative of similar performance. Cheers to the educated consumer.
customer_reviews.author: W McBride

customer_reviews.title: Very reasonable CPU with good number of cores with some ability to overclock
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonable CPU with good number of cores with some ability to overclock. Don't expect miracles, it will most likely get to about 4.1 - 4.2 Ghz, not significantly more. Anything above will be impractically hot. Price is slightly less reasonable, but that's obvious. 8 core i7-6900K might be a better option for those who prefer slightly better overclock.
customer_reviews.author: Elena N.

customer_reviews.title: This price is way too high.

Intel actually hacked CERN's Quantum Data Files using Celeron Processors ( single core, 500mhz) and downloaded 6 Terabytes worth of Intellectual Property. I added this badboy on my Compaq computer, and it's now solving 22 Blockchain algorithms per month ($$$)

customer_reviews.title: delidded!Dual layers of pcb.
customer_reviews.text: Is extremely hard to delid with a typical razor because of the 2nd layer of pcb (where the processor die is on) is also glued on the heat spreader. I have to first heat it up and then pry it open.

customer_reviews.title: worth every $
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT overpriced. The benchmarks are competitive with the $2000-4000 Xeon processors - and it's cheaper. Granted you don't get the multisocket options you do with Xeon.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Looks like Intel is testing the limits of what they can ...
customer_reviews.text: Complete shakedown. Looks like Intel is testing the limits of what they can charge when there is no viable competiton from AMD. Simple as that. It reminds me of some new-money guy gold plating his Mercedes. Adds nothing to the oveall functionality but sends the overall cost sky high. I am sure there will be the core count argument but if your time is that valueable then Xeon would be the better platform to be on.
customer_reviews.author: DSF

customer_reviews.title: Good but you dont need this much power
customer_reviews.text: Look, yes it's expensive, but what do you expect for a i7 of this capacity? The 6700k is more that adiquit for all Daily and gaming needs, if you don't know what the de tales in the description mean, you probably don't need this prosseser

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast of a CPU... ...

customer_reviews.author: Nishant sahay

customer_reviews.title: not enough cores/dollar to be a good server chip
customer_reviews.text: This product at this price point makes absolutely no sense....not enough cores/dollar to be a good server chip.....not enough clock speed to be an effective gamer. Its a shame that intel even made this product, it would have been smarter to wait longer and give us a product that actually makes improvements on old stuff....not performed equivalently (at best) at around double the price. This product is for "people with more money than sense"
customer_reviews.author: Edgar C.

customer_reviews.title: If all you do is edit video then have at it but I refuse to be flipped upside down and have my pockets shaken like this. Intel s
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with the numbers up so far with these cpu's that I would sell off my 5960 eight core that is stable at 4.6 GHz under custom water and shell out an extra $750 for 2 cores and a tad more cache. If all you do is edit video then have at it but I refuse to be flipped upside down and have my pockets shaken like this.Intel should be ashamed of themselves. I might have considered $1200 but $1750, no way......

customer_reviews.title: This is what happens when we got no competition folks
customer_reviews.text: For the performance you are getting... This cpu is way too overpriced, and the reason intel is getting away with this is because we currently got no real competition on the cpu market until zen arrives.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced what were you thinking Intel
customer_reviews.text: For a consumer grade processor this is way overpriced for the power. Most applications won't even used more than 8 cores, and for the slower clock rate it is not worth it. If you are thinking about going with this, then you might as well build using a xeon. You can get refurbished xeon e5-2670 for $70 with 8 cores.
